intro: Oxypetalum coriaceum, commonly known as the roughleaf oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 10,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are thick and leathery, giving it a distinctive appearance. Oxypetalum coriaceum is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
